moveForward

public boolean moveForward()
Makes the CluelessRobot back up one space. The CluelessRobot remains facing the original direction.

Overrides:
moveForward in class Robots.Robot
Returns:
true if the CluelessRobot was able to back up one space, false otherwise.

retreat

public boolean retreat()
Makes the CluelessRobot move forward one space. The CluelessRobot remains facing the original direction.

Overrides:
retreat in class FastRobot
Returns:
true if the CluelessRobot was able to move forward one space, false otherwise.

public int moveForwardThree()
Makes the CluelessRobot back up three spaces. The CluelessRobot remains facing the original direction.

public int zigLeftThree()
Makes the ClulessRobot attempt to move diagonally towards his right three times. The robot remains facing the same direction.

Overrides:

Returns:

public int zagRightThree()
Makes the CluelessRobot attempt to move diagonally towards his left three times. The robot remains facing the same direction.

Overrides:
zagRightThree in class FastZigZagRobot
Returns:
the number of completed diagional moves

leftSquare

public boolean leftSquare()
Makes the CluelessRobot move in a right square. A right square is defined as three spaces forward, a right turn, three spaces, a right turn, three spaces, a right turn, three spaces and a right turn. The robot should end up facing the same direction as he started. If the robot is unable to complete the entire movement it should return to the original position facing the original direction.

Overrides:
leftSquare in class SquareRobot
Returns:
true if the robot was able to complete the Right Square movement, false otherwise

rightSquare

public boolean rightSquare()
Makes the CluelessRobot move in a left square. A left square is defined as three spaces forward, a left turn, three spaces, a left turn, three spaces, a left turn, three spaces and a left turn. The robot should end up facing the same direction as he started. If the robot is unable to complete the entire movement it should return to the original position facing the original direction.

Overrides:
rightSquare in class SquareRobot
Returns:
true if the robot was able to complete the Left Square movement, false otherwise
